intro: Glochidion gamblei, commonly known as the Gambier glochidion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the Philippines and is characterized by its small, leathery leaves that are often covered in fine, white hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by elliptical, woody fruits. Glochidion gamblei is typically found in lowland forests and is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its native habitat.
